_comment: Example API response from a security scan

vulnerabilities.name: Broken Object Level Authorization
vulnerabilities.description: API endpoints are vulnerable to broken object level authorization. Attackers can access objects belonging to other users by manipulating object IDs.
vulnerabilities.evidence: Returned user data for user_id 98765 when authenticated as user_id 12345.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Implement proper authorization checks to ensure users can only access objects they own or have permission to access.  Use parameterized queries and avoid direct object references.  Consider using a Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) system.

vulnerabilities.name: Unrestricted Resource Consumption
vulnerabilities.description: API is vulnerable to unrestricted resource consumption.  Attackers can exhaust server resources by sending a large number of requests or large payloads.
vulnerabilities.evidence: Server response time increased significantly after sending a large number of requests with large payloads.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Implement rate limiting, pagination, and input validation to prevent resource exhaustion. Consider using a Content Delivery Network (CDN) to cache static content.

vulnerabilities._comment: Example of a low severity issue
vulnerabilities.name: Improper Assets Management
vulnerabilities.description: API lacks proper assets management.  Debug endpoints are exposed in production.
vulnerabilities.evidence: Debug endpoint /debug/healthcheck is accessible without authentication in production.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Disable or remove debug endpoints from production environment. Implement proper authentication and authorization for sensitive endpoints.
